SEARCH

Class Date

java.lang.Object
Date
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Date>
public class Date extends Object implements Comparable<Date>
This is the Date class which manages all the generations of dates This checks for all the edge cases provided by the project description: 1. February day range difference during a leap year 2. Each month's maximum day value (different for different months) 3. Checks if a date is in the past, present, or future 4. Checks if a date is more than six months in the future 5. Checks if a date has a valid month, day, and year
Author:
Yuet Yue, Varun Doreswamy

  • Constructor Details

    • Date

      public Date(String date)
      This is the constructor method for creating dates The date object contains month, day, and year as separate ints
      Parameters:
      date - gets read and split into separate ints for manipulation

  • Method Details

    • isLeapYear

      private boolean isLeapYear()
      This method checks if a year is a leap year
      Returns:
      TRUE if it is a leap year, FALSE if it is a non-leap year

    • checkMonthDays

      private boolean checkMonthDays()
      This method validates the maximum day value for a specified month
      Returns:
      TRUE if the max day is valid to a proper month, FALSE if not

    • getDate

      public static Date getDate(String date)
      This method acts as a getter method for the date
      Parameters:
      date - gets read and added into a new object
      Returns:
      the new date object in mm/dd/yyyy format

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid()
      This method validates the inputted dates based on specified edge cases This validates month, day, and year values This also validates the day range for specific months
      Returns:
      TRUE if the date is valid, FALSE if the date is invalid

    • isToday

      public boolean isToday(Calendar today)
      This method checks if the selected calendar date is today
      Parameters:
      today - used as a point of comparison to today's calendar date
      Returns:
      TRUE if the inputted date is today, FALSE if it's not today

    • isBeforeToday

      public boolean isBeforeToday(Calendar today)
      This method checks if the selected calendar date is in the past
      Parameters:
      today - used as a point of comparison to a date before today
      Returns:
      True if the date is in the past, FALSE if it's not in the past

    • isWeekend

      public boolean isWeekend(Calendar date)
      This method checks if the selected calendar date is on a weekend
      Parameters:
      date - used to check if the selected date is on Sat or Sun
      Returns:
      TRUE if date is on the weekend, FALSE if it's not

    • isInFuture

      public boolean isInFuture(Calendar date)
      This method checks if the selected calendar date is in the future
      Parameters:
      date - used to check if the selected date is after today's date
      Returns:
      TRUE if the date is in the future, FALSE if it's not

    • isBeyondSixMonths

      public boolean isBeyondSixMonths(Calendar today)
      This method checks if the date is beyond six months into the future
      Parameters:
      today - used to check if the date is beyond six months
      Returns:
      TRUE if beyond six months into the future, FALSE if it's not

      This method returns the date in the proper String format

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(Date other)
      This method compares the values within date for sorting purposes
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<Date>
      Parameters:
      other - the object to be compared with the month, day, and year
      Returns:
      -1 if date is earlier, 1 if date is later, 0 if date is equal

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object object)
      This method checks for duplicate date objects
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      object - to compare another date object for duplicate checking
      Returns:
      TRUE if the date is a duplicate, FALSE if it is different

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      This main method acts as the testbed main() for this class Test Edge Cases: 1. Year value below 1900 2. Max day value that does not exist to a corresponding month 3. Invalid month value 4. Invalid day value 5. February leap-year constrictions
      Parameters:
      args - as the input of dates used for testing edge cases
